author: Derek Main
message: Morning @Nelson Musoliwa That's because we allow our leaders to get away with it. @Nelson Musoliwa Yes - it should be a law that all government ministers must use public facilities. "@Nelson Musoliwa Theri kids must go to government schools @Robert Russell Unfortunately the Geneva convention is no longer worth the paper it is written on. The US regularly flouts it with their actions around the world. "@makhosi nobhatyi If they all faced the consequences for their actions @PATRICK MANALA That is true and they are nothing but fools. @makhosi nobhatyi @Ndim Mavuks You must be fools to vote for a party that has proven to be so corrupt. You are voting for more of the same. @Ndim Mavuks I know you can't be convinced. I'm just telling you you're a fool if you can't see the ANC is corrupt to the core. "@Ndim Mavuks Have you not been listening to anything at this commission?? You need to take your blinkers off. It seems the problem is not the ANC @Ndim Mavuks The point is that the ANC is corrupt to the core and their members can't seem to see it. @Robert Russell Hence why I say the ANC is corrupt to the core. "@Ndim Mavuks I don't need someone to explicitly say ""The ANC is corrupt"". It can be deduced from the evidence so far." @Ndim Mavuks Can you honestly say that none of the evidence here has pointed any fingers at ANC members? @Cerebis Yes exactly - look at the bunch of criminals they have put forward for us to vote for. @Ndim Mavuks I understand your historic connections to the ANC but that organisation is dead a long time ago. The ANC of today is an entirely different animal. Time for you to find a new hero. @Cerebis One thing you can be sure of with Ace is that he is plotting something. He's a gangster. @Cerebis Ace is busy setting up a parallel government. @Ndim Mavuks @Rusty SpyGoat As I said Ndim (and I know you have some difficulty comprehending) - it doesn't have to be stated explicitly - it is possible to hear evidence given and form an opinion. @makhosi nobhatyi What both the DA and the ANC are doing in Alex is shameful. Just finger-pointing with no accountability while the people suffer. "@makhosi nobhatyi If you are trying to imply that the ANC is not using the Alex situation for politicking @Mandla cyril Mankoe I'll bet you believe in the tooth fairy too. @Cerebis I agree - politicians being politicians. Shameful! @carnoth ngomane So vote for any other party execpt the DA or ANC then. It's not rocket science. @makhosi nobhatyi I put it to you that the ANC is not capable of fixing problems they created in the first place. You're only fooling yourself. @Mandla cyril Mankoe True - the only problem is the ANC bag would be empty. @Brian Mercado That's right - we have just changed one set of corrupt politicians with another. "@carnoth ngomane You're going to get my advice anyway. Use it "@Ndim Mavuks You're using the ANC stratgey of ""If you tell a lie often enough @carnoth ngomane That's fine by me - I'm not going to stop saying it. You will wake up eventually. "@makhosi nobhatyi Absolutely @carnoth ngomane And you keep your head stuck firmly in the sand. @makhosi nobhatyi Why don't you tell us a bit about how the ANC cadres stole the money that was meant to be used for improvements in Alex? @Themba J Thobela A conservative estimate. @carnoth ngomane Coming from someone who thinks the ANC is cool - that's no surprise. @Ndim Mavuks Expecting the ANC to sort out corruption is like expecting the Ku Klux Klan to sort out racial prejudice. @carnoth ngomane There are plenty of alternatives. It's just that the fool ANC supporters can't see the immense harm the ANC is doing to SA. @Themba J Thobela And the common denominator in all the looting is the ANC. @carnoth ngomane Dude! You're hurting my feelings! ü§£

author: Magda Seguin
message: It's not stories...The then police minister nhleko is being proven to have acted illegally according to the Constitutional Court judgement Nhleko interferes with the independence of IPID Mugabe was rushed to Singapore for medical treatment.Just goes to show how he destroyed his country that he has no faith in his own health system.Its an African problem.Mabuza was treated in Russia Even the Nigerian president was treated in the UK for months...disgraceful Is that true? So apparently ear infections can't be treated in Nigeria...how crazy Politicians lie constantly and gullible people believe and vote for them time after time @Afrika that is not true.. Do you know of other heads of states or politicians coming to Africa for medical treatment? We have brilliant medical professionals but they are forced to leave yhe coubtry due to bad government policies I rest my case...its your choice to believe what you believe...btw I am not illiterate or dumb "There are hundreds if unemployed doctors that completed their community service Tr√®s been merci Monsieur Russell St vous? *Et Chouette! tout va bien alors Tes the two emails that Werksmans produced this morning was debunked by McBride's testimony The Constitional court judgements proved IPID's independence and that the Minister of Police at the time interfered @Robert Russell I feel that way about de Klerk knowing his regime killed thousands @Lew464 try to learn about apartheid history..it's a shame that apartheid worked so well that we don't know about each other's pain and suffering. So how many innocent civilians do you think died during 40 years of apartheid? When the casspirs entered the townships nobody was safe Security forces? against the majority of a population to uphold a racist regime? As long as part of South Africans are in denial about apartheid we will never be able to reconcile In the 80's if you didn't get home drenched in teargas and given 5 minutes to disperse with helicopters hovering above you will never know what we went through @Jack...I don't consider that number as remotely accurate I don't know @Robert just judge g from the comments here makes me think that it is a microcosm of denialism @Lew464 I am not going to engage on semantics with you This is the apartheid denialism and apologetic approach that Holocoast denialists also come up with. I don't pander to apartheid denialism Making excuses for a crime against humanity makes you complicit A sane and logical person should condemn ALL violence...not in isolation when it suits their agenda I NEVER said it's ok to kill civilians..I just find it strange that people who mentions McBride' s actions must look in the mi...those who supported apartheid Just say outright that you maybe hoped Mc Bride was hanged...he was on death row like so many others. @makhosi don't change the subject...this is a specific discourse...we are all against the looting of the ANC and corporates. My last words on this...somebody said over the weekend that the Apartheid regime and the past 24 years plus is exactly the same thing.We are still being oppressed...just a different oppressor. And I agree "@Rust true...look how the Sudanese deposed Bashir after a 30 year dictatorship @makhosi and Ace has the gall to do door to door with a straight face @Rusty Correct @Rusty it is correct in part as the Apartheid government was brought to it's knees by both the struggle and external pressure due to the international work done by Oliver Tambo and his team outside SA "South Africa is the most diverse country in the world there is no comparison with USA Most of the countries mentioned diversity is due to immigration It is thus more difficult to achieve unity and equality In SA The US diversity is very recent history Apart from the US colonizers that mostly came from Italy and Ireland Yes South Africa is the most diverse...medical researchers call it the 'natural laborotary' due to the genetic pool Time out Best just to follow the proceedings...too tiring on this forum

author: Jack Sparrow
Ndim Mavuks
message: Dilip pls read the TRC transcript Was there any common sense as far as the whole racist apartheid system is concerned including the actions of Wouter Basson "We buried 10 The Magoo's Bar incident was a legitimate military target as it was frequented by the apartheid army officers unlike the earlier Sharpeville massacre. McBride remains a hero of the liberation struggle "Then white arrogance declared ""no one is to blame"" for the senseless people of more than 60 people" Makhosi you are correct that is why we will give the ANC a 2/3 majority Rusty I align myself more with the political that led to economic and international pressure and Derek it is too late to try and convince us with insults with just a few days to go before elections "Repeating the lies that the ANC is corrupt does not turn into the truth. I am sure all the corruption happening in the private and public sector equals to ""the ANC is corrupt"" Then what is the point? "Tell me of one testimony in this commission that explicitly said ""The ANC is corrupt"" with facts and evidence" Pls Rusty tell that to Derek Robert who was held responsible for the Sharpville Massacre no one Mashaba learnt the tendencies of white arrogance so prevalent today Now we talking Mindlos "Thanks Rusty """SA belongs to all who live in it"" Freedom Charter adopted by the ANC" "SA is home to all Including racists farmers who abuse the people "We wish all opposition parties well as they fight for opposition seats "The ANC is not corrupt "No I am repeating what you said Derek: ""corrupt politicians"" remember" After the 2/3 majority victory after the May 8 elections The only hope for the country in terms of fighting corruption and reduce racialised unemployment and inequality is a decisive ANC victory as confirmed as confirmed by the ratings agencies The ANC has over the years made a lot of progress and the majority knows it and yes ngomane dealing with the corrupt elements will surely follow "Ngomane

author: Rusty SpyGoat
message: If we lived in any other country or society Praising the ""liberation struggle"" is more anecdotal than what actually led to the end of apartheid. What really stopped apartheid was international economic and political pressure." It's the same as praising the 'Jewish struggle' for the defeat of the Nazi's. When in actual fact it was the allied forces that defeated the Nazi's.. "The question is; Is the ""rainbow nation"" possible to achieve? Can we live in a multicultural society "If we can not live in a true 'multicultural society' then we should create seperate states "Lew464 but how do we achieve equal opportunity? It seems to be so far away. Not only in SA but look at USA "Magda Seguin SA is not the most diverse country in the world. It is very diverse no doubt Ndim Mavuks Tell me one testimony in this commission that explicitly said anyone is corrupt? This is an enquiry. This is not a criminal prosecution. "Derek Main I get that "Im not diminishing the tragedy of the Sharpville Massacre. It was horrible "I am a descendant from a Danube Schwabe. Germans that were genocided in communist Yugoslavia after WW2 Ndim Mavuks Nothing in my statement insinuated 'move on'. At least I acknowledge the suffering caused to black South Africans. You however lack empathy to sympathize my greater loss.
